prompt: Subtle ambient motion: aurora borealis made of code shimmers overhead, data waterfalls cascade from floating islands, crystalline structures pulse with inner light, sleeping cloud creatures breathe gently, deep blues shift to warm gold accents. No new objects, preserve exact art style.

Ukiyo-e Japanese woodblock print, a great wave crashes in slow motion, Mount Fuji in background, cherry blossom petals blow across the scene, bold black outlines, flat perspective, traditional indigo and cream colors, Hokusai's Great Wave reimagined in motion. 16mm film grain.

Letterpress printing in extreme close-up, metal type blocks being pressed into thick cotton paper, ink spreading through the fibers in real time, the satisfying pressure leaving deep impression marks, warm workshop lighting, hands in leather apron visible, dust particles in golden light beam. ASMR visual quality.

Northern lights timelapse over an abandoned church in Iceland, green and purple aurora dancing across the sky, the Milky Way visible through breaks in the light, snow-covered landscape, the church is small and white with a red roof, warm light from a single window. Shot on Canon EOS R5, 14mm f/1.8, 15-second exposures stitched.

Bioluminescent ocean shore at night, waves wash up glowing blue plankton, each wave leaves trails of light that fade like dying embers, wet sand reflects starlight, a single person sits on the beach watching, their silhouette dark against the blue glow. Kodak Portra 400, pushed two stops, heavy grain.
